node.title: Almost 100pc of New Caledonians who voted rejected independence from France â€” but here's what the numbers aren't telling you
node.alt: Election observers at a vote count.
node.description: The territory now faces an uncertain future, as pro-independence groups refuse to discuss a future under France's flag.
node.content:
["New Caledonians have voted to remain a territory of France, but with less than half of eligible voters turning up at the ballots, questions remain over the future of the Pacific territory.", "Sunday's third and possibly final referendum on independence went ahead despite calls from pro-independence leaders to postpone the vote.", "Official results revealed that though 96.49 per cent of voters rejected independence from France, only 43.9 per cent of eligible voters headed to the polls.", "That was because pro-independence groups, made up mainly of indigenous Kanak people, had called for a boycott of the referendum after France declined a request to delay the ballot to allow for a traditional mourning period following a surge in COVID cases in September.", "The boycott had an obvious impact on voter turnout when compared to previous votes. In 2018 and 2020 the participation rates were almost double this year's, at more than 80 per cent.", "\"This third referendum has revealed a fracture and separation of the society really well,\" said John Passa, a sociologist from the University of New Caledonia.", "The territory now faces an uncertain future, as pro-independence groups refuse to discuss the future of New Caledonia with France.", "", "
New Caledonia is one of several French territories in the Pacific.\u00a0(ABC News: Jarrod Fankhauser)
", "
Is the vote valid?
", "France does not have mandatory voting, and therefore there is no minimum participation rate needed for results to be verified.", "New Caledonia's commissioner for the vote, Francis Lamy, authorised the results yesterday, saying electoral experts from the United Nations had certified the results.", "He said the boycott \"does not affect the regularity or the legitimacy of the vote on December 12\", and that since voters were free to cast their ballot, the result was not compromised.", "", "
Thierry Santa was New Caledonia's president until earlier this year.(Supplied: Facebook)
", "Anti-independence politician Thierry Santa, president of New Caledonia's conservative party, The Rally, says the results show\u00a0the majority of New Caledonians want\u00a0to remain with France.", "\"Despite this strong boycott, I consider this is the third time that we Caledonians have expressed ourselves,\" he said.", "\"The first two times, everyone voted, and the No vote won by a majority.\"", "But not everyone agrees.", "Roch Wamytan, a pro-independence politician and President of New Caledonia's Congress, has asked for the results to be thrown out.", "He is currently in France and says he is seeking advice from the UN about how to hold another independence vote next year.", "\"For us, this was not the third referendum,\" Mr Wamytan said in an interview with Franceinfo.", "\"I denounced, in front of the United Nations, the fact that the French government organised this referendum on December 12, even though we did what was necessary \u2026 for President [Emmanuel] Macron to delay the vote until September 2022.\"", "Despite New Caledonia now being in a period of transition until 2023 to decide on its future, pro-independence groups have refused to enter into discussions until France's presidential election in April next year.", "", "
Roch Wamytan is seeking help from the UN to have the latest referendum result thrown out.\u00a0(ABC News: Prianka Srinivasan)
", "
Why were there three votes \u2013 and could there be another?
", "It can feel like d\u00e9j\u00e0 vu in the Pacific archipelago, with voters being asked the same question three times: \"Do you want New Caledonia to gain full sovereignty and become independent?\"", "Independence votes\u00a0took place in 2018, 2020 and in 2021 because of a 30-year peace deal called the Noumea Accords, signed and voted into law in 1998 and set to end once the final referendum is held.", "It states that New Caledonians can have up to three chances to cut ties with France, as long as a third of Congress agrees with that decision.", "Under the accord, if all three votes result in a majority \"no\" \u2014 as is the case now \u2014 then the territory will not have the ability to \"go back\".", "But Dr Passa says it will be difficult for France to proceed without the cooperation of pro-independence groups.", "\"[The French state] have decided \u2026 that there will be no more votes, that once we reach the end of the Noumea Accord that everything will go back like how it was before,\" he said.", "\"That's impossible.\"", "", "
John Passa says the referendum has demonstrated the division within New Caledonian society.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "Mr Santa, the anti-independence politician,\u00a0agrees\u00a0another referendum is needed, but says it should not ask voters about independence.", "\"From today, we open a new, blank page in the story of New Caledonia which all of us have to write together,\" he said.", "\"We need to come to the table, discuss together about a new solution, a new agreement that will then be presented to the people Caledonian so they can vote on it for the next referendum.\"", "
What does this mean for Australia and the Pacific?
", "The Melanesian Spearhead Group, which includes representatives from PNG, Fiji, Solomon Islands and New Caledonia's pro-independence FLNKS party, has urged the UN to mark the third referendum as \"null and void\".", "\"Voter turnout was below 50% of registered voters hence cannot be taken as the legitimate wish of the silent majority!\" the MSG said in a tweet.", "In both 2018 and 2020, Australia's\u00a0Minister for Foreign Affairs, Marise Payne, released a statement about New Caledonia's referendum the day after the vote took place, but this year there has not been a release.", "The ABC is yet to receive a response from the Department of Foreign Affairs about New Caledonia's referendum on Sunday.", "Dr Passa says the uncertainty over New Caledonia's future and its continued dependence on France has compromised its relationship with countries in the Pacific, including Australia.", "He says it would be more efficient and less costly if New Caledonia can find solutions within the region.", "\"There will always be solidarity within the Pacific,\" he said.", "
Can peace be maintained?
", "Despite France bolstering troops and police enforcements over the weekend of the referendum, the vote passed calmly.", "No major instances of violence or disturbances were recorded, despite fears in the lead-up that the boycott could reignite long-held tensions between pro and anti-independence blocs.", "But for many Kanak people, the desire for independence is linked to their hopes for New Caledonia to acknowledge and reconcile with its violent colonial legacy.", "", "
Emmanuel Tjibaou believes New Caledonia will eventually become independent.(Supplied)
", "Emmanuel Tjibaou's father, Jean-Marie, was the leader of the Kanak independence movement before being assassinated in 1989.", "His grandfather was just 10 years old when the French military killed members of his tribe for refusing to participate in World War I.", "\"It's quite a long way for us to go but we still believe that our country will stand free,\" he said.", "\"We believe our future will never go under the French flag.\"", "Dr Passa calls violence a \"trap\" that pro-independence groups could fall into, but says inequalities between Kanak and non-Indigenous New Caledonians have laid bare the need for more permanent change in the territory.", "\"The relationship with France has always been a colonial relationship,\" he said.", "\"The pro-independence Kanaks don't want to end New Caledonia's relationship with France, they are asking for us to\u00a0take another look at this relationship.\"", "Many voters who side with France also believe in a \"common destiny\" which more equally shares New Caledonia's riches and promotes Kanak identity.", "", "
Despite fears of violence, the referendum at the weekend remained peaceful.\u00a0(ABC: Prianka Srinivasan )
", "Mr Santa says\u00a0France is the only country that can\u00a0protect Kanak people and maintain peace.", "\"We need France to protect our freedoms, to construct the identity of our future, and respect the Kanak identity,\" he said, adding that an independent New Caledonia's mineral assets could fall into the hands of China without France's protection.", "\"I am not sure that China will respect our traditions, our culture, our way of life,\" he said.", "He is optimistic that pro-independence politicians will soon join discussions about New Caledonia's future.", "\"I'm sure they will take up their responsibility to come to the table to discuss,\" he said."]
